newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq volume reaches record high in Q1 1997.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq volume reaches record high in Q1 1997.

text.p: Nasdaq stock market average daily volume reached a record 623.5 million shares in the first quarter of 1997, up 13 percent from an average 551.6 million in the fourth quarter of 1996, the exchange said on Monday.

Total shares traded in the first quarter of 1997 reached 37.4 billion, well above the 35.4 billion set in fourth quarter 1996, but slightly below the 37.98 billion measured in the second quarter of 1996.
Daily dollar volume reached a new record of $16.9 billion, up 22.5 per cent from $13.8 billion measured per day in fourth quarter 1996, Nasdaq said.
For the whole of the first quarter of 1997, dollar volume was a record $997 billion, compared to the previous quarterly record of $882.8 billion, which was set in the fourth quarter of 1996.
